title: [又贏] 100 個年輕人宜居城市

replies.msg:
100個年輕人宜居城市香港包尾 排名比北京、台灣低！

香港樓價高企是眾所周知的事情，人人都上樓難。另一方面，新一代與老一年的矛盾亦不斷增加。有唔少人都覺得香港的年輕人上位難、上樓難，難道香港真係咁唔適合年輕人居住？

德國租房平台nestpick最近發表了一份「最適合年輕人居住的城市」名單，調查結果從商業生態系統、生活日常、城市開放程度及娛樂這4大範疇，共16個評分要素，包括就業前景、衣食住行、網速、性別平等、對移民容忍度、對LGBT的友善度、夜生活等等計算排名。在調查的100個城市之中，荷蘭的阿姆斯特丹摘得桂冠，而香港則位居榜尾，排第95位。

頭10名城市都由歐洲城市包辦，頭3位分別是阿姆斯特丹、柏林及慕尼黑。阿姆斯特丹奪冠主要因為其對LGBT（同志文化）較友善、開放及包容。柏林精彩多姿的夜生活符合年輕一代“work hard play hard”生活態度，故排名第二。


排行尾5的香港，在商業生態系統這個大範疇中表現得不錯，就業前景（9.2/10）、旅遊發展（8.9／10）方面均奪得高分。不過生活日常方面則得分較低，在住屋及醫療的得分更不足一分。

亞洲城市之中，曼谷排名最高，排第47位。而北京則排第80、台北排第81、首爾排第93位。

而港人愛去的東京及大阪，則分別排第98和97，排名比香港更後。日韓排名落後主要因為對初創企業支持不足、食物價格高、避孕率低及性別不平等因素。


頭十排名：

1. 阿姆斯特丹（荷蘭）
2. 柏林（德國）
3. 慕尼黑（德國）
4. 里斯本（葡萄牙）
5. 安特衛普（比利時）
6. 巴塞隆納（西班牙）
7. 里昂（法國）
8. 科隆（德國）
9. 巴黎（法國）
10. 溫哥華（加拿大）

全部排名
https://www.nestpick.com/millennial-city-ranking/

... 上刪 94 個排名 ...

95. 香港
96. 上海
97. 大阪
98. 東京

好野, 香港又贏蝗同日本仔, 畀 D 獎聲自己

香港最美麗的風景依然係樓價呀

成個調查根本就係用歐洲人角度睇香港

例如transport，可能覺得香港d車路窄所以比低分。但public transport方面香港真係方便到秒殺其他城市 呢點已經睇得出個methodology好biased

甚至歐洲之內都有biased。個調查係德國出的，然後berlin同munich就分別排第二同第二。北歐就一個都冇。

除左樓價同創意，我睇唔出邊點香港值咁低排名

Housing Score - Affordable rent is one of the hot topics for Millennials today. With rent ever increasing and salaries not so much, affordable housing is a huge draw for Millennials.

The London Governing Authority recommends that one person needs a minimum of 39 square metres for their living space. To produce our Housing Score, we used rental listings from each city to find out the monthly cost of renting 39 square metres, and then ranked the cities from most affordable to most expensive.

Transport Score - The number of Millennials who use cars is decreasing. Yet they still need to be able to get around a city easily to commute to work, to travel to meet friends at a reasonable cost.

The transport score factored in the length of the metro network, the number of metro stops, the length of the tram network and the number of tram lines per capita. It also considered the availability of Uber, and the existence of a bike-sharing scheme.

Health Ranking - Millennials are highly health conscious, and access to decent healthcare and fitness options are important to this demographic.


Food Ranking - Everyone’s gotta eat!

The food ranking was calculated based upon the affordability of a monthly cost of food, with data provided by Expatistan and reviewed individually for each city in the ranking.

The Access to Contraception - Being highly educated about sexual health, having access contraception when it is needed is a necessity for Millennials.

話人地老作既, 自己睇下人地個準則先啦

係囉, 外國人又惡意造鳩香港

你永遠就只係識無腦反港
搵d實例黎?

旅遊: High levels of tourism within a city not only offers entry level jobs to all age groups, but attracts younger crowds, looking to explore popular cities. Travelling to a city is also one of the first steps to relocating there, and as such is an essential for Millennials.

交通: The transport score factored in the length of the metro network, the number of metro stops, the length of the tram network and the number of tram lines per capita.

健康: The health ranking was calculated based on The World Health Report conducted by the UN. (其實即係人均年齡、aids比率個d野，香港係全球人均年齡最高、aids其中一個最低既地方)

食物: The food ranking was calculated based upon the affordability of a monthly cost of food, with data provided by Expatistan and reviewed individually for each city in the ranking. (如果佢係講食物物價咁香港係排得低既)

網絡: The internet speed ranking was produced based on data provided by internet providers in each of the respective cities. (香港網速全球頭3)

夜生活: The Night Scene Ranking considers the number of clubs and the opening times.

根本佢個評分就有問題
交通個d唔用平均數去計、用總長計
健康既數據唔知點黎
食物只係計物價而唔計食物多樣化
網速又係唔知點解香港咁低
夜生活只係局限clubing，但全世界都話香港夜生活多

你反得黎都比d理由
香港就係多得你依d無腦既反港人士搞到依家咁

日韓排名落後主要因為對初創企業支持不足、食物價格高、避孕率低及性別不平等因素。

最後兩個擺明係優點黎喎

Housing Score - Affordable rent is one of the hot topics for Millennials today. With rent ever increasing and salaries not so much, affordable housing is a huge draw for Millennials.

The London Governing Authority recommends that one person needs a minimum of 39 square metres for their living space. To produce our Housing Score, we used rental listings from each city to find out the monthly cost of renting 39 square metres, and then ranked the cities from most affordable to most expensive.

Transport Score - The number of Millennials who use cars is decreasing. Yet they still need to be able to get around a city easily to commute to work, to travel to meet friends at a reasonable cost.

The transport score factored in the length of the metro network, the number of metro stops, the length of the tram network and the number of tram lines per capita. It also considered the availability of Uber, and the existence of a bike-sharing scheme.

Health Ranking - Millennials are highly health conscious, and access to decent healthcare and fitness options are important to this demographic.


Food Ranking - Everyone’s gotta eat!

The food ranking was calculated based upon the affordability of a monthly cost of food, with data provided by Expatistan and reviewed individually for each city in the ranking.

The Access to Contraception - Being highly educated about sexual health, having access contraception when it is needed is a necessity for Millennials.
